intro: Ectotropis seanii-hoganii, commonly known as the Hogan's mountain bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its tuberous roots are adapted to store water and nutrients, enabling it to survive in its specific ecological niche. Due to habitat loss, Ectotropis seanii-hoganii is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
